text-node.description: This pipeline is used to go to LoginBarrier-Show
This pipeline is a check for all private pages, except Content and Categories, to see if the Current Customer is authenticated
This pipeline checks the public custom attribute of a category to see if the category is public or private
This pipeline is used to check that a content page hit has public facing content
This pipeline sets the referring url then redirects to LoginBarrier
This pipeline redirects back to the referring url before the LoginBarrier was shown.
This pipeline is used to check if a library folder should be displayed or not
This pipeline is used to check that a category page hit has a public facing category
This pipeline checks the public custom attribute of a content asset to see if the content is public or private
This pipeline displays the login barrier page for Portal users if they are not authenticated. It loads all necessary forms before doing so.

pipelet-node.custom-name: Please note the backwards logic in From_1, it is correct, please do not change

pipelet-node.description: Delete 'TempChainCode' to prevent portal pages from displaying incorrect content slot configurations. JIRA Ticket Reference CPS-662 for more information.

text-node.description: Return to Login Barrier without reloading forms.
This pipeline is used to prompt a customer with a address selection dialog and then set the address upon selection. The setting also runs a PAV check on all products the customer has in their basket.
This pipeline is used to check if any products in the current users order, basket, or other LIC is unshippable
Address form valid so update selected shipping address.
Delete 'TempChainCode' to prevent portal pages from displaying incorrect content slot configurations. JIRA Ticket Reference CPS-662 for more information.
Use redirect template instead of jump node to home-show, because it would get cached
The following pipeline checks to see if the user is a portal user or not.
This pipeline receives an address and product ID and checks if the user can purchase it and if there are any conflicting exclusions.
This pipeline is used for the CS Suite to run a PAV check for products
This pipeline grabs all customer shipping addresses based on a customer number
This pipeline is used to update a user's shipping address based on their selection from the on page hopup
Assign price books based on the selected shipping address.
Now set the default address as we have useable pricebooks for this address.
